commands.description: Create an SSH session to a dyno
commands.help:
Usage: heroku ps:exec [flags]

Create an SSH session to a dyno

Flags:
 -a, --app APP        app to run command against
 -d, --dyno DYNO      specify the dyno to connect to
 -r, --remote REMOTE  git remote of app to use
 --ssh                use native ssh
 --status             lists the status of the SSH server in the dyno

Example:

    $ heroku ps:exec 'node -i' --app murmuring-headland-14719
helpLine: Create an SSH session to a dyno

commands.description: Launch a SOCKS proxy into a dyno
commands.help:
Usage: heroku ps:socks [flags]

Launch a SOCKS proxy into a dyno

Flags:
 -a, --app APP        app to run command against
 -d, --dyno DYNO      specify the dyno to connect to
 -r, --remote REMOTE  git remote of app to use

Example:

    $ heroku ps:socks --app murmuring-headland-14719
    Establishing credentials... done
    SOCKSv5 proxy server started on port 1080
    Use CTRL+C to stop the proxy
helpLine: Launch a SOCKS proxy into a dyno

commands.description: Forward traffic on a local port to a dyno
commands.help:
Usage: heroku ps:forward PORT [flags]

Forward traffic on a local port to a dyno

Flags:
 -a, --app APP              app to run command against
 -d, --dyno DYNO            specify the dyno to connect to
 -p, --localPort LOCALPORT  the local port to use
 -r, --remote REMOTE        git remote of app to use

Example:

    $ heroku ps:forward 8080 --app murmuring-headland-14719
helpLine: Forward traffic on a local port to a dyno

commands.description: Copy a file from a dyno to the local filesystem
commands.help:
Usage: heroku ps:copy FILE [flags]

Copy a file from a dyno to the local filesystem

Flags:
 -a, --app APP        app to run command against
 -d, --dyno DYNO      specify the dyno to connect to
 -o, --output OUTPUT  the name of the output file
 -r, --remote REMOTE  git remote of app to use

Example:

    $ heroku ps:copy FILENAME --app murmuring-headland-14719
helpLine: Copy a file from a dyno to the local filesystem
